intro: Symbolanthus mathewsii subsp. mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' symbolanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
